title: Solar Orbiter Level 2 Low Latency Magnetometer Data - T. Horbury (The Blackett Laboratory, Imperial College London)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'EPOCH' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/solar-orbiter/mag/low_latency/ll02/2020/solo_ll02_mag_20200603t000016-20200604t000015_v01i.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 55.6824% of the 1024 timesteps. Cadence = 8000013312 [ns] = PT8.000013S.
info.contact: T. Horbury @ The Blackett Laboratory, Imperial College London

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Epoch encoded as Terrestrial Time on rotating Earth geoid, ns since J2000

parameters.name: B_RTN
parameters.description: Magnetic field vector in RTN coordinates, 8 second resolution

parameters.name: B_SRF
parameters.description: Magnetic field vector in spacecraft reference frame, 8 second resolution
